byline.contributor: David Montgomery reported from Hempstead, and Michael Wines from New York. Mitch Smith contributed reporting from Lisle, Ill., and Richard Pérez-Peña, Ashley Southall and Liam Stack from New York. Jack Begg contributed research.
byline.original: By DAVID MONTGOMERY and MICHAEL WINES

abstract: Waller County, Tex, Sheriff R Glenn Smith says that Sandra Bland, who was found dead in jail cell, told county jail officials that she tried to kill herself in 2014, statement that Bland's family disputes; despite statement, jailers had not put Bland on suicide watch; disagreement comes day after Texas authorities released dashboard camera video of Bland's arrest by State Trooper Brian T Encinia, who has since been placed on administrative duty.
lead_paragraph: Sandra Bland, who was found hanging in a jail cell, told officials that she tried last year to kill herself, a sheriff said. But her family said they had seen no signs of depression.

headline.main: Dispute Over Sandra Bland’s Mental State Follows Death in a Texas Jail
headline.print_headline: Dispute Over Woman’s Mental State Follows Death in a Texas Jail

snippet: Sandra Bland, who was found hanging in a jail cell, told officials that she tried last year to kill herself, a sheriff said. But her family said they had seen no signs of depression.
